questions.prompt: How would you explain SSH to a teammate, and why is it fundamental for cloud computing?
scenario_seeds: A junior developer asks why we can't just use a web-based terminal to manage our production servers
Your security team wants to know how engineers access cloud VMs without exposing credentials over the network
A new team member is confused why they need to 'SSH into' a server instead of just accessing files directly
questions.grading_rubric: Must explain SSH as an encrypted protocol for secure remote access AND describe it provides command-line access to servers AND explain why encryption is essential for cloud infrastructure.

questions.prompt: Walk me through why SSH keys are more secure than passwords for server authentication.
scenario_seeds: Your security audit found that some servers still allow password authentication and you need to justify requiring SSH keys
A colleague argues that their strong password is just as secure as SSH keys and wants to know why they should switch
After a brute-force attack attempt was logged on your servers, management asks how SSH keys would have prevented it
questions.grading_rubric: Must explain asymmetric cryptography (public/private key pair) AND describe why keys can't be brute-forced like passwords AND explain that private keys never travel over the network.
